content:
The milestone tracker gives support agents a complete view of upcoming and completed milestones, and displays countdowns for active and overdue milestones. It is available in both Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience.

To add the milestone tracker:

In Salesforce Classic:
  - Add it to the case feed or work order feed.
  - From object management settings for cases, go to Page Layouts and edit Feed View.
  - Select the Milestone Tracker and specify where on the page you want it to appear.
  - Click Save.

In Lightning Experience:
  - Go to Lightning App Builder and add the Milestones component.
  - You can opt to hide the Mark Completed link from your agents.

To set how time displays in the milestone tracker:

  - From Setup, enter Entitlement Settings in the Quick Find box, then select Entitlement Settings.
  - In the Milestone Tracker section, deselect Show the time remaining in actual hours, not business hours.
  - Click Save.

The milestone tracker helps support agents be prepared for support deadlines by showing them:
  - The time remaining until an active milestone reaches its Target Date
  - The time passed since an overdue milestoneâ€™s Target Date
  - A list of upcoming milestones
  - A list of completed milestones
title: Configuring the Milestone Tracker in Salesforce
